use_case_name: Display Traffic and Environmental Heat Maps
context_of_use: This use case allows a Regular User to view traffic and environmental heat maps to make informed decisions.
stakeholders_and_interests: Regular User: Wants to access accurate traffic and environmental data for better decision-making.
city planners: Require reliable data to improve urban planning and infrastructure.
environmental agencies: Need data to monitor environmental conditions.
description: Allows a Regular User to view traffic and environmental heat maps to make informed decisions.
triggering_event: Regular User requests to view heat maps.
preconditions: The Regular User is logged into the system.
The system has up-to-date traffic and environmental data.
postconditions: The traffic and environmental heat maps are displayed to the Regular User.
The user can interact with the maps for detailed information.
assumptions: The Regular User has the necessary permissions to access the heat maps.
The system has a mechanism to retrieve and display the latest data.
requirements_met: The system shall allow Regular Users to view traffic heat maps.
The system shall allow Regular Users to view environmental heat maps.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the data sources for traffic and environmental heat maps.
main_flow: 1. Regular User requests to view heat maps → System retrieves the latest traffic and environmental data.
2. Regular User selects the type of heat map to view → System displays the selected heat map.
3. Regular User interacts with the heat map for detailed information → System provides additional data based on user interaction.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 1): If the system cannot retrieve data, it informs the Regular User of the unavailability.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 3): If the interaction with the heat map fails, the system notifies the Regular User of the failure and suggests retrying.
